data.name: baro
data.value: Influence of the baro sensor on the throttle (proportional use 0-1) Zero is off.

data.name: baroDif
data.value: Influence of the baro sensor on the throttle (differential use 1-4)

data.name: baroTemp
data.value: Temperature compensation for baro sensor (use 0) It is always best to allow the quad to aclimate to a temperature change for 5-10 minutes before flying.

data.name: Differenzial
data.value: Corrects oscillations. The differential value is always a negative set sign to proportional value. The value is too high or too low, when the quad bounces or oscillates. Values of -99 to 99 (mostly -20 to +20, but values of up to +/-70 are effective) For YAW use 0.

data.name: EbenenAusgleich
data.value: Vertical velocity damping correction value. Minimizes a rapid climb quad response to wind gusts. Recommended values 0 to -4.

data.name: EmpfaengerImpulse
data.value: Usually positive for Futaba and Hitech and negative for Graupne/Robbe/JR. Chooses which receiver pulse is being used by your RX/TX (positive or negative).

data.name: GasKanal
data.value: Graupner/JR modes (K1=Throttle, K2=Roll, K3=Pitch, K4=Yaw) Futaba/Robbe/Spek modes (K1=Roll, K2=Pitch, K3=Throttle, K4=Yaw)

data.name: HalbRollNick
data.value: Roll and Pitch stick sensitivity is 50% less if checked. This is particularly useful for proportional values > 20 and helpful for beginners!

data.name: Impuls
data.value: Update rate of controllers Minimum recommended value is +2. Normal value is +4 to+6. Note how motors start and the stick responsiveness and adjust if necessary!

data.name: Integral
data.value: *Always the same sign as proportional! Effects the total gyro/acc value over time. Important for the Heading Lock of the yaw channel. A value too high causes the quad to osciillate, a value that is too small causes a poor return to level. Values of -99 to 99. Recommended 0 to 15.

data.name: IntegralLimiter
data.value: Integral Limiter Always positive! Low value causes slow return to level. Too high a value can cause flips. Recommended values +2-+5. Upper value is limitied by the your Integral setting.

data.name: Integrierzustand
data.value: LEDs showing condition of integral (only indicating function, no influence on the parameters)

data.name: Kameraausgleich
data.value: Effects how strong the pitch/rolling motions at the camera servos will be. Connect to K5=pitch servo. K6=roll servo. A setting of 0=no gyro control. Start with a setting of 1 and increase if necessary.

data.name: Kompass
data.value: Effects how strong the deviation from target heading direction corrects back to heading after moving the yaw stick. Values of -99 to +99. Normal is 6-8.

data.name: Leerlaufgas
data.value: Allows motors to have a minimum throttle to prevent them from stopping in the air and also to have them all spinning for initial launch.

data.name: Limiter
data.value: Limiter (always positive!) Use 35 for YAW

data.name: Neutral
data.value: Neutral values of the accelerometer are captured when the quad is initially powered on. It is important that the quad is not jiggled if neutral values are taken and input into the data windows. These values will vary by accelerometer and breakout board installation, but should remain fairly constant over time. They should be re-checked especially after a very "hard landing", or a board re-mount. You can also use the "Get values" button to automatically copy the data to the windows.

data.name: Proportional
data.value: Effects gyro control strength corresponding to stick input. The value is too low, when the quad reacts poorly or uncontrollably to stick inputs. The value is too high if the quad is oscillating. Values of -99 to 99. For YAW use 0.

data.name: Unterspannung
data.value: Alarm setting for the red LED and buzzer if installed for the Lipo voltage. Recommended values for 3s Lipos from 43 to 48.

data.name: XModus
data.value: Quad flight orientation. + = an arm forward into flight direction X = 2 armsforward in flight driection (45° staggerd to + modes) Note: X mode may require changes to Proportional, Integral and Differential parameters.
